newsitem.title: USA: Gerber Products recalls baby rattles.
newsitem.headline: Gerber Products recalls baby rattles.

text.p: Gerber Products Co. said Wednesday it will recall about 60,000 baby rattles because they pose a choking and inhalation hazard to young children.
Gerber, a unit of Swiss drug and nutrition company Sandoz AG, said the recall involves red-handled versions of the Gerber Flip Fingers Rattle, but not green-handled versions.

Yellow spherical end caps attatched to the rattles' bright red, U-shaped handle may separate, Gerber said, releasing small parts, such as spinning plastic pieces and noise-making beads, which could present a choking hazard.
Gerber said it will offer consumers a full refund for the rattles, which were introduced in May at a retail price of $1.39 and sold in grocery stores and speciality stores.

The part number listed on the toy's clear plastic package on a blue card is 76250. The Fremont, Mich.-based baby food company said consumers should immediately take the rattles away from their children and call Gerber at 1-800-4-GERBER.
Gerber, which made the announcement in conjunction with the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission, said it has received reports five of the rattles breaking, but has not heard of any injuries.

Gerber spokesman Van Hindes said the company has not yet determined whether it will introduce a new version of the red-handled Flip Fingers rattle. The company, whose main business is baby food, buys the product under contract from a manufacturer in China, Hindes said.
